properties.name: name

properties.name: author

properties.name: atvisePortOpc
properties.description: The new project's atvise server OPC port.

properties.name: atvisePortHttp
properties.description: The new project's atvise server HTTP port.

properties.name: useLogin
properties.description: If the new porject's atvise server requires login.

properties.name: atviseUsername
properties.description: The new project's atvise server login name.

properties.name: atvisePassword

properties.name: configLang

name: InitOptionsAsArray

name: src/init/OptionsValidator.js
InitOptionsValidator
description: A static class containing validators for the options used when running "atscm init".

name: name
description: Validates a project name to be a valid npm package name.

return.description:
Returns true if `value` is a valid npm package name, or an error
message otherwise.

name: src/init/init.js
content:
import InitTask from './InitTask';

export default InitTask.run.bind(InitTask);

name: src/lib/config/Atviseproject.js

properties.name: opc
properties.description: The OPC-UA port the atvise-server runs on.

properties.name: http
properties.description: The HTTP port the atvise-server can be reached at.

name: login
description: The login to use. Return `false` if no login is required (default).

properties.name: username
properties.description: The username to log in with.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password to log in with.

name: useTransformers
description: The transformers to use in this project. Defaults to a single {@link DisplayTransformer}

name: nodes
description:
The atvise-server nodes that atvise-scm should sync. Defaults to
`['ns=1;s=AGENT', 'ns=1;s=SYSTEM', 'ns=1;s=ObjectTypes.PROJECT']`

name: nodesToWatch
description:
The atvise-server nodes to watch in the corresponding tasks. Defaults to all nodes containing
displays.

name: EditorRelatedNodes
description: An array of editor related node ids. They should be ignored in a atvise-scm project.

name: ServerRelatedNodes
description:
An array of server related node ids. They should be ignored in a atvise-scm project
as they are read-only.

name: ignoreNodes
description:
These nodes (and their subnodes, if any) will be ignored by atvise-scm. Defaults to
{@link Atviseproject.EditorRelatedNodes} combined with
{@link Atviseproject.ServerRelatedNodes}.

name: inspect
description: Returns an object containing the properties to inspect.

InitOption

An option the "atscm init" command handles.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a new option based either on a message and (optionally) a default value or some
options.

params.name: messageOrOptions

params.name: messageOrOptions.message

The option's message. Required if `messageOrOptions`

The options's choices. Applies to to list
types only.

params.name: messageOrOptions.when

Weather or not to
prompt this option.

name: message
description: The option's message. A '?' sign is added automatically.

name: choices
description: The choices available. Applies to list types only.

name: validate
description: Validates the user input for this option.

name: when
description: A function or boolean that indicates weather or not to prompt this option.

name: DefaultType
description: The default {@link inquirer~PromptType} to use. Equals 'input'.

name: src/lib/server/AtviseFile.js
ExtensionForDataType
description: A map providing shorter extensions for data types

name: DataTypeForExtension
description:
A map providing data types for shorter extensions (Reverse of {@link DataTypeForExtension}).
* @type {Map<String, node-opcua~DataType>}

name: extensionForDataType
description:
Returns the extension for a specific {@link node-opcua~DataType}.
Algorithm:
  - if the type has a shortened extension defined in {@link ExtensionForDataType}, return it.
  - else return the DataType's name, in lowercase letters.

params.name: dataType
params.description: The datatype to get the extension for.

name: AtviseFile
description: An extension to {@link vinyl~File} providing some additional, atvise-related properties.

properties.name: AtviseFile#dataType
properties.description:
The {@link node-opcua~DataType} the node is
stored against on atvise server.

properties.name: typeDefinition
properties.description:
The file's type definition on atvise server.
FIXME: Additional properties not showing in API docs.

name: pathForReadResult
description: Returns a storage path for a {@link ReadStream.ReadResult}.

params.name: readResult
params.description: The read result to get a path for.

name: encodeValue
description: Encodes a node's value to file contents.

params.name: dataType
params.description: The {@link node-opcua~DataType} to encode the value for.

return.description: The encoded file contents or null.

name: decodeValue
description: Decodes a file's contents to a node's value

params.name: dataType
params.description:
The {@link node-opcua~DataType} to decode the contents
for.

return.description: The decoded node value or null.

name: normalizeMtime
description:
As file mtimes do not support millisecond resolution these must be removed before storing
files.

name: fromReadResult
description: Creates a new {@link AtviseFile} for the given {@link ReadStream.ReadResult}.

params.name: readResult
params.description: The read result to create the file for.

name: _getMetadata
description:
Recalculates {@link AtviseFile#dataType}, {@link AtviseFile#arrayType} and
{@link AtviseFile#typeDefinition}. **Never call this method directly.**

name: isQuickDynamic
description: `true` for files containing atvise quick dynamics.

name: value
description: Sets the node value for the file.

name: value
description: Returns the decoded node value for the file.

name: nodeId
description: Returns the node id associated with the file.

name: clone
description: Returns a new file with all attributes of the current file.

name: read
description: Creates a new AtviseFile and reads it's contents.

return.description:
Resolved with the new file of rejected with the error that occured while
trying to read it's path.

Client

return.description:
Fulfilled with an already connected
{@link node-opcua~OPCUAClient} instance, rejected if an error occured.

name: src/lib/server/NodeId.js
constructor
description:
Creates a new NodeId. Can be called in multiple ways:
 - with a {@link node-opcua~NodeIdType}, a value and a namespace (defaults to 0),
 - with a value only (type will be taken from it, namespace defaults to 1) or
 - with a {@link NodeId}s string representation (e.g. `ns=1;s=AGENT.DISPLAYS`).

params.name: typeOrValue
params.description: The type or value to use.

name: fromFilePath
description: Creates a new NodeId based on a file path.

name: filePath
description: The node id's value, encoded to a file path.

name: inspect
description:
Returns a string in the format "namespace value" that is printed when inspecting the NodeId
using node.js's *util.inspect*.

return.description: A string in the format "namespace value".

name: src/lib/server/NodeStream.js
NodeStream
description: A stream that browses the nodes specified and (if *recursive* option is set) it's child nodes.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new NodeStream based on the nodes to start browsing with and some options.

params.name: nodesToBrowse
params.description: The nodes to start browsing with.

params.name: options.recursive
params.description: If the discovered nodes should be browsed as well.

params.name: options.ignoreNodes
params.description:
An array of {@link NodeId}s
to ignore.

name: recursive
description: If the discovered nodes should be browsed as well.

name: ignoredRegExp
description: A regular expression matching all node ids specified in {@link NodeStream#ignoreNodes}

name: processErrorMessage
description: Returns an error message specifically for the given nodeId.

params.name: nodeId
params.description: The node id to get the error message for.

name: processChunk
description: Returns a {ReadStream.ReadResult} for the given reference description.

types: function(err: Error, statusCode: node-opcua~StatusCodes, onSuccess: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description: The error handler to call. See {@link QueueStream#processChunk} for details.

name: src/lib/server/QueueStream.js
QueueStream
description: A stream that process atvise server requests in parallel.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new QueueStream with the given options.

params.name: options.maxParallel
params.description: The maximum of parallel tasks to execute.

name: _processed
description: The number of chunks processed so far.

name: _maxParallel
description: The maximum of parallel tasks to execute

name: _start
description: The timestamp of the date when the stream was created.

name: hasPending
description: `true` if there are queued operations or an operation is running right now.

name: queueEmpty
description: `true` if there are no queued operations

name: processed
description: The number of chunks already processed.

name: opsPerSecond
description: The number of processed chunks per second.

name: processErrorMessage
description:
The error message to use when processing a chunk fails. **Must be overridden by all
subclasses!**

name: processChunk
description:
The function to call when a chunk is ready to be processed. **Must be overridden by all
subclasses.**
examples:
<caption>Basic implementation</caption>
class MyQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => handle(err, statusCode, done => {
      // This is called if err is falsy and status code is node-opcua~StatusCodes.Good
      doSomethingWith(result);
      done();
    }));
  }
  ...
}

<caption>Implement a recursion</caption>
class RecursiveQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => handle(err, statusCode, done => {
      // Write the result back to the stream.
      // This means, that `result` will be queued and, as soon as possible, #processChunk will
      // be called with `result` as the `chunk` argument.
      this.write(result, null, done);
    }));
  }
  ...
}

<caption>Allowing some invalid status codes</caption>
import { StatusCodes } from 'node-opcua';

class FriendlyQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => {
      if (statusCode === StatusCodes.BadUserAccessDenied) {
        Logger.warn(`Ignored invalid status: ${statusCode.description}`);
        handle(err, StatusCodes.Good, done => done());
      } else {
        handle(err, statusCode, done => done());
      }
    });
  }
  ...
}

types: function(err: Error, statusCode: node-opcua~StatusCodes, onSuccess: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description:
Call this function to handle errors and bad status codes. When no error occured
and the status code received is fine, `onSuccess` is called. Further processing of valid
chunks, e.g. recursions should happen in `onSuccess`. **Note that `onSuccess` is an
asynchronous function with a callback as an argument.**

name: _processChunk
description: Calls {@link QueueStream#processChunk} and handles errors and invalid status codes.

emits.description: Emits a `processed-chunk` event once a chunk was processed.

name: _enqueueChunk
description: Enqueues the given chunk for processing.

name: _transform
description: Calls {@link QueueStream#_enqueueChunk} as soon as the stream's session is opened.

params.name: callback
params.description: Called once the chunk has been enqueued.

name: _flush
description: Waits for pending operations to complete.

params.name: callback
params.description: Called once all queued chunks have been processed.

params.name: referenceDescription

The reference description to get
the error message for.

name: processChunk

params.name: referenceDescription
params.description:
The reference description to read
the atvise server node for.

params.name: handleErrors

name: src/lib/server/Session.js
Session
description: A wrapper around {@link node-opcua~ClientSession} used to connect to atvise server.

name: emitter
description: An {@link events~Emitter} that emits events when creating / closing sessions.

name: create
description: Creates and opens a new {@link node-opcua~ClientSession}.

return.description:
Fulfilled with an already opened
{@link node-opcua~ClientSession}.

emits.description: Emits an `all-open` event once all opening sessions are open.

params.name: deleteSubscriptions
params.description: If active subscriptions should be closed as well.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the (now closed!) session or
rejected with the error that occured while closing.

Rejected with the error that occurred while closing the
sessions or fulfilled with the (now closed) sessions affected.

name: src/lib/server/Stream.js
Stream
description: An object transform stream connected to atvise server.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new Stream and starts opening a new session to atvise server.

params.name: options
params.description:
The options to use. See
[through2 documentation](https://github.com/rvagg/through2#options) for details.

params.name: options.keepSessionAlive
params.description:
If the ativse server session should be closed
one the stream ends.

emits.description:
Emits an `session-open` event once the session is open, passing the Session
instance.

name: _keepSessionAlive
description: `true` if the stream's atvise server session should be kept alive once the stream ends.

name: _flush
description: Called just before the stream is closed: Closes the open session.

params.name: callback
params.description: Called once the session is closed.

AtviseTypes
description:
The atvise types to handle. **Ordering matters:** The {@link MappingTransformer} takes the first
match, therefore **plain types should always come before resource types!**

{node-opcua~ClientSubscription} Emits a `subscription-started` event once the

name: processErrorMessage

The reference description to get
the error message for.

name: processChunk
description: Monitors the nodes specified by a {@link node-opcua~ReferenceDescription}.

Buffers all read node descriptions until the subscription started, then calls

params.name: callback

Called with the error that occured while trying to

name: src/lib/transform/PartialTransformer.js
PartialTransformer
description: A transformer that transforms only some of the files read.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new partial transformer with the specified options.

params.name: options
params.description:
The options to use. See {@link Transformer#constructor} for available
options.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to transform or not.

name: _transform
description: Transforms a file if {@link PartialTransformer#shouldBeTransformed} returns `true`.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured
while transforming or (optionally) the transformed file.

name: applyToStream
description:
Applies the transformer to the given stream. It does so by running the following steps:
 - Pipe the {@link PartialTransformer#filter} stream
 - If PartialTransformer#applyToFilteredStream is overrridden, apply it.
 - Otherwise pipe {@link Transformer#withDirection}.
 - Restore the filter stream

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream to apply the transformer to.

name: applyToFilteredStream
description:
Applies a stream transformer to the given, already filtered stream. Override this method if you
want to pipe streams directly. Returning a falsy value (e.g. false, null, undefined) invokes
{@link Transformer#transformFromDB} or {@link Transformer#transformFromFilesystem} instead.

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream to apply the transformer to.

name: src/lib/transform/SplittingTransformer.js
CombineFilesCache
description:
Determines which files are needed to create a combined file and stores these files as long as
some of them are missing.

name: _files
description: The files caches for the given path.

name: _required
description: The extensions of the files required.

name: missingExtensions
description: Returns the extensions of the missing files for the given `dirname`.

params.name: dirname
params.description: The cache key to look for.

name: gotAllFiles
description: Checks if, when `file` is added, all required files are cached.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to add before checking.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error
that occured while checking or all files related to `file` if all required files are already
cached.

name: SplittingTransformer
description: A transformer that splits files into multiple others.

name: _combineFilesCache
description: The cache used when collecting files to combine.

name: createCombinedFile
description: Creates a combined file from the cached split files.

params.name: files
params.description: The cached files stored against their extensions.

params.name: lastFile
params.description:
The last file collected. This is the only file guaranteed to be
set, therefore us if for error messages, etc.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Should be called with any errors
that occur while combining the files, or optionally the resulting file.

name: transformFromFilesystem
description:
Calls {@link SplittingTransformer#createCombinedFile} as soon as all dependencies are
required files are cached.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error occured while
caching files or creating the combined file or optionally the resulting combined file.

name: splitFile
description: Splits a {@link vinyl~File}: The resulting is a clone of the input file, with a different path.

params.name: newExtension
params.description: The extension the resulting file gets.

name: combineFiles
description: Combines split files to a single one.

params.name: newExtension
params.description: The extension the resulting file gets.

name: _flush
description:
If there are any missing files this method loads these files and calls
{SplittingTransformer#createCombinedFile} with them.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occurred while loading
missing files.

name: src/lib/transform/Transformer.js
TransformDirection
description: The directions a transformer can be run in.

name: Transformer
description:
A special kind of an object transform stream: It does apply different transformations based on
it's direction.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new Transformer with the specified options.

throws.description: Throws an error if the given direction is invalid.

name: _options
description: The options the transformer was created with. Used for printing description.

name: withDirection
description: Returns the Transformer with the given direction

throws.description: Throws an error if the given direction is invalid.

name: _transform
description:
Calls {@link Transformer#transformFromDB} or {@link Transformer#transformFromFilesystem}
based on the transformer's direction.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured while
transforming or (optionally) the transformed object.

throws.description: Throws an error if the transformer has no valid direction.

name: transformFromDB
description:
**Must be overridden by all subclasses:** Transforms the given chunk when using
{@link TransformDirection.FromDB}.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured while
transforming or (optionally) the transformed object.

name: transformFromFilesystem
description:
**Must be overridden by all subclasses:** Transforms the given chunk when using
{@link TransformDirection.FromFilesystem}.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured while
transforming or (optionally) the transformed object.

name: applyToStream
description:
Applies the transformer to the given stream. By default this just invokes
{@link Transformer#transformFromDB} or {@link Transformer#transformFromFilesystem}. Override
this method if you want to pipe streams directly.

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream to apply the transformer to.

name: applyTransformers
description:
Creates a stream with all transformers passed, with the given direction. Transformers are
reversed if using {@link TransformDirection.FromFilesystem}.

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream to apply the transformers to.

return.description: The last transformer passed, piped to the previous.
A string representation of the transformer.

name: src/lib/transform/XMLTransformer.js
XMLTransformer
description: A transformer used to transform XML documents.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new XMLTransformer based on some options.

name: _fromDBBuilder
description: The builder to use with direction {@link TransformDirection.FromDB}.

name: _fromFilesystemBuilder
description: The builder to use with direction {@link TransformDirection.FromFilesystem}.

name: builder
description: Returns the XML builder instance to use base on the current {@link Transformer#direction}.

name: decodeContents
description: Parses XML in a file's contents.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the parsed document or the
parse error that occurred.

name: encodeContents
description: Builds an XML string from an object.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the resulting string or
the error that occurred while building.

name: tagNotEmpty
description: Helper function: Returns `true` if the given tag exists and is not empty.

params.name: tag
params.description: A tag in a parsed xml document.

return.description: `true` if the given tag exists and is not empty.

name: forceCData
description: Forces `string`, when assigned as textContent to a node, to be wrapped in a CDATA-section.

params.name: string
params.description: The string to force a CDATA-section for.

return.description: The string to assign as textContent to a node.

pull

name: src/tasks/push.js

watch

name: src/transform/DisplayTransformer.js
DisplayTransformer
description:
Splits read atvise display XML nodes into their SVG and JavaScript sources,
alongside with a .json file containing the display's parameters.

name: shouldBeTransformed
description: Returns true for all files containing atvise displays.

name: transformFromDB
description:
Splits any read files containing atvise displays into their SVG and JavaScript sources,
alongside with a .json file containing the display's parameters.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured
while transforming the display, or the file passed through.

name: createCombinedFile
description: Creates a display from the collected files.

params.name: files
params.description: The collected files, stored against their extension.

params.name: lastFile
params.description: The last file read. *Used for error messages only*.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured
while creating the display or the resulting file.

name: src/transform/Mapping.js
MappingTransformer
description: A Transformer that maps {@link ReadStream.ReadResult}s to {@link AtviseFile}s.

name: transformFromDB
description:
Writes an {@link AtviseFile} for each {@link ReadStream.ReadResult} read. If a read file has a
non-standard type (definition) an additional `.rc` file is pushed holding this type.

params.name: readResult
params.description: The read result to create the file for.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occurred
while transforming the read result or the resulting file.

name: transformFromFilesystem
description: Writes an {@link AtviseFile} for each {@link vinyl~File} read.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occurred
while transforming the read result or the resulting file.

name: src/transform/ScriptTransformer.js
ScriptTransformer
description:
A transformer that splits atvise scripts and quick dynamics into a code file and a .json file
containing parameters and metadata.

name: shouldBeTransformed
description: Returns `true` for all files containing script code or quick dynamics.

return.description: `true` for all files containing script code or quick dynamics.

name: transformFromDB
description:
Splits any read files containing scripts or quick dynamics into their JavaScript sources,
alongside with a .json file containing parameters and metadata.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured
while transforming the script, or the file passed through.

name: createCombinedFile
description: Creates a script from the collected files.

params.name: files
params.description: The collected files, stored against their extension.

params.name: lastFile
params.description: The last file read. *Used for error messages only*.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occured
while creating the script or the resulting file.

name: src/typedef/external/inquirer.js
content:
/**
 * @external {Inquirer} https://github.com/sboudrias/Inquirer.js
 */

/**
 * Must be one of: 'list', 'rawlist', 'expand', 'checkbox', 'confirm', 'input', 'password',
 * 'editor'.
 * @typedef {String} inquirer~PromptType
 * @see https://github.com/sboudrias/Inquirer.js#prompt-types
 */

/**
 * A function that, when called with a value, validates this value and either retunrs `true` if
 * validation succeeded or an error message.
 * @typedef {function(value: String): Boolean|String} inquirer~Validator
 */

name: inquirer~Validator
description:
A function that, when called with a value, validates this value and either retunrs `true` if
validation succeeded or an error message.

params.name: signal
params.description: The signal that triggered the exit.

return.description: `true` if the process should continue exiting.
